Articles.Content:
Wow! This looks great, I love it when people make stock-a-like parts like this. Also, you might want to clear up your grammar on the OP.

Thanks. Also: english is not my first language :I

Thanks. Also: english is not my first language :I

Well you've done a very good job mostly - I cleaned up the spelling/grammar in the part descriptions for my own use but I can publish them if you'd like (Or let you know what needs changing). I can proof-read stuff for you too if you like

Well you've done a very good job mostly - I cleaned up the spelling/grammar in the part descriptions for my own use but I can publish them if you'd like (Or let you know what needs changing). I can proof-read stuff for you too if you like

Well if you could upload the .cfg files somewhere where I can get them I'll happily add the corrections to the next update.
Beautiful.

We welcome you, our new "stockalikist" comrade!

Seriously beautiful.

Well if you could upload the .cfg files somewhere where I can get them I'll happily add the corrections to the next update.

Just sent you a pm with a link to a set of revised descriptions.
*/cheering wildly. Wooohooo! Beuatiful parts!
Very pretty and well though out parts. + rep.
Yes, very well done. Small is good.
This adapter witch spherical tanks inside is reallt nice!
Omg! These look amazing and add some much needed love to adapters/structural parts! Excellent work!
is this compatible with ferram aerospace? just wondering if the fuel tanks act like nose cones or not
Very good looking parts. For future updates i would like some ground probing tools for science and have small T and L shaped girders like the long small one you have.
I wish people would make more stockalike parts, these are beautiful.
These are amazing!!! absolutely amazing!!! Can you make a zip file!
I love it when little nifty parts like these appear on the forums. Thank you!

If you do feel a need to reduce poly count, I suggest making the girder just a box with an "inside-out" box on the inside; then texture the outer and inner surfaces with transparent "windows" to make it look like it contains crossbeams without having to model or unwrap any of them.
Wow neat i really like useful stock-a-like parts!

I second the lower poly-count on the truss, 'coz I use them a lot ^^

Pretty and usefull is what this mod is!

If you do feel a need to reduce poly count, I suggest making the girder just a box with an "inside-out" box on the inside; then texture the outer and inner surfaces with transparent "windows" to make it look like it contains crossbeams without having to model or unwrap any of them.

That might lower the poly count but it would no longer be stock-a-like which is my main concern.

dont worry about the poly count thats not what kills your computer as much as many thing for ksp. u dont want it to high but these are fine. ive uses these on my 300+ part ships on my 70+ mod install and works no differnt than it was before so they fine.
Along the lines of the TP-205a Adapter Fuel Tank (The stacked spherical tanks) I would love to see some stock-alike parts for life support mods
They also look like awesome fairing bases.... hmmmm

Love these parts, I don't think I've built a rocket without them since I downloaded it. Would you consider doing an RCS version of the tank cap parts? I often end up putting the small stackable tanks on the tops of twin engines and it just looks...cheap. I'd love to see an elegant solution like you've done with the liquid fuel tanks!

Love these parts, I don't think I've built a rocket without them since I downloaded it. Would you consider doing an RCS version of the tank cap parts? I often end up putting the small stackable tanks on the tops of twin engines and it just looks...cheap. I'd love to see an elegant solution like you've done with the liquid fuel tanks!

I might do something like that.
